revised_title: Investigation of Magnetic Behavior of Iron and Other Metals under Oscillatory Discharge
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the magnetic behavior of iron and other metals under oscillatory discharge from a condenser. They discovered that the damping factor is affected by the self-induction and the introduction of iron wire cores. The results showed that hysteresis loss is negligible compared to eddy-current loss, and the permeability of iron remains similar at high frequencies as under steady magnetic fields.
